title: Israel did not achieve all its aims in Iran attack, says report; did Netanyahu's gamble backfire?
content: Foreign Policy magazine reports that Israel's recent 12-day war with Iran, termed a "failed gamble" by Benjamin Netanyahu, failed to achieve its objectives. Despite aiming to eliminate Iran's strategic threat, the conflict exposed Israel's vulnerabilities and strengthened Iranian nationalism. Iran retaliated effectively, targeting Israeli cities and even a US airbase in Qatar.

title: India to get 1st batch of 3 US Apaches this month
content: The Indian Army is set to receive the first three of six Apache attack helicopters, dubbed "tanks in the air", around July 15, under a Rs 5,691 crore deal with the US. The remaining three are expected by November.

title: Honeymoon murder rerun? Newlywed gets husband killed to keep 15-yr affair with uncle alive
content: In Bihar's Aurangabad, a 45-day-old marriage ended tragically with the murder of Priyanshu Kumar Singh, allegedly orchestrated by his wife, Gunja Singh. Motivated by a desire to continue her long-term affair with her maternal uncle, Gunja conspired to eliminate her husband, drawing inspiration from the Meghalaya honeymoon murder case.

title: Spy planes, minesweepers: Nod for 1L crore purchases
content: Defence ministry has approved acquisition projects worth over Rs 1 lakh crore. The approvals include indigenous construction of mine countermeasure vessels, procurement of quick-reaction surface-to-air missile systems, and intelligence, surveillance, target acquisition & reconnaissance planes. Other projects include semi-submersible autonomous vessels, armored recovery vehicles, and electronic warfare systems to boost India's defense capabilities.

title: In snub to China, India says only Dalai can pick successor
content: India has firmly rejected China's claim regarding the selection of the next Dalai Lama, asserting that the decision rests solely with the current Dalai Lama and Tibetan Buddhist traditions. Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju criticized China's interference and reaffirmed the Dalai Lama's exclusive authority in choosing his successor.

title: Leave India...: Foxconn to Chinese staff at Indian iPhone factories; What's Beijing's role
content: Apple's iPhone production faces disruption as Foxconn experiences a significant withdrawal of Chinese engineers from its Indian facilities, impacting the ramp-up for iPhone 17 manufacturing. This exodus, influenced by China's efforts to restrict technology transfer and skilled labor exports, threatens Apple's ambitious goals to shift iPhone production to India amidst rising geopolitical tensions and supply chain diversification efforts.

title: ED arguments over in Herald case, it's Gandhis' turn now
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has asserted in a Delhi court that the National Herald case is a clear instance of money laundering. They allege Young Indian Pvt Ltd, involving Sonia and Rahul Gandhi, was created to illicitly transfer Rs 2,000 crore from Associated Journals Ltd (AJL).

title: Partition survivor who was saved by a Muslim dies at 102
content: Ram Krishan Singh, a 102-year-old survivor of the 1947 Partition, passed away in Punjab's Patiala. During the violent upheaval, his father was murdered, but Ram Krishan was saved by a Muslim villager's courageous intervention. His life exemplified resilience and the enduring impact of kindness amidst the horrors of communal violence, leaving behind a legacy of compassion.

title: Amazon changes appraisal system: Wants employees to work ‘like’ CEO Jassy; what’s changing
content: Amazon is integrating its Leadership Principles into employee evaluations, impacting salary increases and performance plans. CEO Andy Jassy's initiative aims to create a more disciplined workforce by combining adherence to these principles with performance and potential ratings. This move, part of broader industry trends, maintains Amazon's stack-ranking system, facing scrutiny for its potential impact on employee morale.

title: 6 families of AI 171 crash victims receive 'second set' of remains
content: Six families of victims from the AI 171 plane crash in Ahmedabad received a second set of remains from the Civil Hospital. These remains, discovered during post-disaster operations, were matched through DNA. While some families may hold a second funeral, authorities confirmed the legality due to DNA evidence and handover certificates.

title: Doctors, experts back govt stand on safety of Covid-19 vaccines
content: Top doctors, industry experts, and pharma leaders refute Karnataka CM's claim linking Covid-19 vaccines to sudden deaths, citing a lack of evidence. They emphasize the rigorous approval process and the vaccines' role in saving millions of lives. Industry leaders endorse India-made vaccines, highlighting their success in combating polio and Covid-19, urging trust in science over doubt.

title: 25 years after his 1st Trinidad trip, PM Modi visit to rekindle diaspora ties
content: Prime Minister Modi is set to visit Port of Spain, marking the first Indian PM's visit to Trinidad and Tobago since 1999. His connection with the nation dates back to 2000 when he attended the World Hindu Conference.

title: No AI without immigration: Zuckerberg’s 11 new hires in superintelligence
content: Meta's new Superintelligence Lab showcases the significant role of immigrants in America's AI leadership. The lab's 11 top AI researchers, all immigrants from countries like India, China, and the UK, previously contributed to OpenAI, DeepMind, and Google.

title: Rain fury: Landslides block over 100 roads in Uttarakhand, hit Kedar yatra
content: Heavy rainfall in Uttarakhand has triggered landslides, blocking roads and disrupting the Char Dham yatra. The Kedarnath yatra was temporarily suspended due to a landslide on the Sonprayag-Gaurikund route, stranding pilgrims. Consequently, pilgrim footfall has significantly decreased, and in Bageshwar, numerous families are at risk due to unstable terrain, awaiting potential evacuation.

title: India committed to voicing issues of Global South: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's historic visit to Ghana marked a significant upgrade in Indo-Ghanaian relations, forging a comprehensive partnership with a strong emphasis on defence and security cooperation. Both nations pledged to double bilateral trade to $6 billion in five years and enhance collaboration in counter-terrorism efforts.

title: EC admitted 20% would fall off voter list: Congress
content: Congress has accused the Election Commission (EC) of conspiring to remove two crore voters in Bihar, alleging a focus on migrant workers. This follows opposition parties' meeting with the EC to contest the special electoral list revision. Congress leaders claim the EC anticipates weeding out 20% of voters, a stance they deem a threat to the Constitution and marginalized communities.

title: Carolina Hurricanes fans react to Brent Burns’ retirement with emotional tributes
content: Brent Burns, renowned for his iconic beard and powerful shot, has retired after a remarkable NHL career, leaving a significant impact on the Carolina Hurricanes. Fans expressed immense gratitude for his contributions both on and off the ice. Burns' leadership, work ethic, and affable nature resonated deeply with the fan base.

title: Dwyane Wade’s wife opened up about her sexual assault and its impact on her marriage to the NBA legend
content: Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union's marriage, spanning over a decade, has weathered numerous challenges. Gabrielle Union bravely shared her past sexual assault and its impact on their relationship during the lockdown. Despite personal traumas and health scares, including Wade's kidney cancer scare, their bond has remained strong, showcasing their unwavering support for each other.

title: Former Portland Trail Blazer shooting guard Ben McLemore found guilty of rape charges after an 11-day trial
content: Former Portland Trail Blazer Ben McLemore has been convicted of rape and sexual abuse stemming from a 2021 incident at a house party in Lake Oswego. The jury found McLemore guilty on three out of four charges, including first-degree rape and unlawful sexual penetration. McLemore, who pleaded not guilty, faces a mandatory minimum sentence of over eight years.

title: In talks with senator seeking to tariff Russia oil buyers: Govt
content: India has expressed its apprehension to US Senator Lindsey Graham regarding his proposed sanctions bill, which could impose significant tariffs on nations, including India, purchasing Russian oil, stated S Jaishankar. This follows a substantial increase in India's Russian oil imports, rising from less than 1% to 40% in three years, driven by discounted prices.

title: Jairam Ramesh 'misses' EC meet after 2-person cap alters Congress plan
content: Despite the Election Commission's specific invitation to party heads for a meeting on Bihar's electoral roll revision, many parties, including Congress, DMK, and TMC, did not send confirmations or their designated leaders. Congress initially arrived with a larger delegation but adhered to the two-person limit, while only CPI and CPI(ML) Liberation had their heads present.

title: NDA allies back EC, call SIR routine & necessary
content: NDA allies in Bihar have voiced strong support for the Election Commission's special intensive revision of electoral rolls, dismissing opposition claims of disenfranchisement. Leaders like Chirag Paswan and Jitan Ram Manjhi assert the exercise is routine and necessary to eliminate bogus voter registrations. They accuse the opposition of undermining constitutional institutions and fear losing the upcoming state election.

title: 4 kids among 5 killed as truck on wrong side rams bike in UP
content: In a tragic incident in Hapur's Hafizpur area, five members of a family, including four children, died when a truck driving on the wrong side of the NH-334 rammed their motorcycle. The driver was attempting to evade toll payment. The victims included Danish Khan and four children aged between 5 and 8.

title: No fight with Muslims: New Bengal BJP chief
content: Samik Bhattacharya, the new BJP state president, stated the party isn't against Muslims, aiming to protect Bengal's diversity amid religious divisions. He advocates for education over violence, contrasting with colleague Suvendu Adhikari's anti-Muslim stance, especially after a bypoll defeat in a Muslim-majority area. Bhattacharya envisions peaceful coexistence, referencing cultural icons and condemning communal violence, while seeking to reassure minority youth.

title: Bold, but difficult mission! How India wants to counter China’s rare earth magnets monopoly
content: China's dominance in rare earth metals poses challenges for India, which seeks to establish a domestic production chain. Despite holding 6% of global deposits, India's output remains low due to technical and economic hurdles. Government initiatives and international collaborations aim to reduce reliance on China, but significant investment and technological advancements are crucial for success.

title: Trump's 'Big, Beautiful Bill': What it does - aid cuts, green funds rollback, reshapes tax system
content: President Trump's "One Big, Beautiful Bill" has passed Congress, bringing significant changes to taxes, healthcare, and immigration. The bill makes Trump's tax cuts permanent, increases the SALT deduction, and cuts Medicaid and food stamps.

title: EC to press ahead with poll rolls revision, says it's lawful
content: Despite opposition concerns about potential voter disenfranchisement, the Election Commission (EC) is proceeding with Bihar's special intensive revision (SIR) of the electoral roll. CEC Gyanesh Kumar emphasized the exercise's transparency and adherence to constitutional and legal frameworks, aiming to include all eligible citizens.

title: Stop 'disparaging' ads against Dabur, Delhi HC tells Patanjali
content: The Delhi High Court has issued an interim injunction against Patanjali, owned by Ramdev, preventing them from running disparaging advertisements against Dabur's Chyawanprash. Dabur alleged that Patanjali's ads made false statements, denigrating their product by claiming that other manufacturers lack the knowledge to prepare 'original' Chyawanprash. The court's decision came after Dabur argued that Patanjali's ads specifically targeted their '40+ herbs' USP, portraying it as inferior.

title: Shivraj Chouhan says 5 lakh PMAY beneficiaries in J&K to be provided houses soon
content: Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan announced that nearly five lakh homeless individuals in Jammu and Kashmir will soon receive housing under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana. With Chief Minister Omar Abdullah present, Chouhan highlighted the near completion of existing allotments and plans for verification of newly identified beneficiaries.

title: Ladakh gears up for Dalai Lama’s month-long visit
content: Ladakh is making final arrangements for the Dalai Lama's month-long visit, starting July 12. He will begin with rest and acclimatization before engaging in public events, including a trip to Zanskar. Top officials are ensuring Z-plus security and medical support, anticipating large crowds from Ladakh and beyond, with Chief Secretary Pawan Kotwal emphasizing high protocol and safety standards.

title: Gill-ed It! Shubman’s 269 a masterclass in patience, discipline and Punjabi grit
content: Shubman Gill's magnificent 269 in the Edgbaston Test showcased his relentless pursuit of excellence. Despite the impressive score, Gill's focus remained on areas for improvement, a trait instilled by his father from a young age. His innings, the highest by an Indian in England, featured remarkable control and discipline, solidifying his ambition to dominate the series.

title: Builder tied to house collapse that killed 3 slapped with NSA
content: In Mathura, builder Sunil Chen faces serious repercussions as the National Security Act (NSA) is invoked against him following a tragic incident on June 15. Unauthorized excavation led to the collapse of five houses in Maya Tila, resulting in the deaths of Totaram, Yashoda, and Kajal.

title: Shift high-risk would-be moms to health centres: Uttarakhand govt
content: Uttarakhand's health department is proactively relocating high-risk pregnant women from remote villages to health centers two weeks before their due dates due to monsoon-related road blockages. Around 500 women need assistance, with arrangements made in Kapkot, Bageshwar, including requisitioned hotels for lodging and meals.

title: Kremlin's new stance on Afghanistan: Russia now officially recognises Taliban govt - reports
content: In a notable diplomatic move, Russia has officially recognized the Taliban government in Afghanistan, as confirmed by Zamir Kabulov to Ria Novosti. This decision, further substantiated by Russia's foreign ministry via TASS, signifies a strengthened relationship with Kabul nearly three years after the Taliban's resurgence.

title: Girl 'rescued' from Tamil Nadu says cop raped her in UP thana
content: In a shocking incident, a 16-year-old girl has accused a sub-inspector of rape within the Kadar Chowk police station complex in Budaun, Uttar Pradesh. The girl alleges the assault occurred after she was brought back from Tamil Nadu, where she had eloped with her boyfriend.

title: 'Aaj lag nahi raha tha Shubman Gill out hoga': Ravindra Jadeja
content: Shubman Gill's magnificent 269 propelled India to a formidable 587 in the first innings of the second Test at Edgbaston. Akash Deep's fiery spell then left England struggling at 77/3, trailing by a massive 510 runs. Jadeja praised Gill's knock and downplayed England's chances of winning, highlighting the strong partnership they built together.

title: 'I will come again': Horrific details of Pune rape case emerge; accused left note
content: In Pune, a 22-year-old IT professional was allegedly raped in her flat by a man posing as a courier executive. The assailant threatened to leak her photos online and took a selfie using her phone before fleeing. Police have launched a manhunt, forming 10 special teams to investigate the crime, which occurred in the Kondhwa area.

title: SuperUnited Rapid 2025: D Gukesh stuns World No. 1 Magnus Carlsen
content: D. Gukesh, the reigning world champion, delivered a stunning blow to World No. 1 Magnus Carlsen at the Grand Chess Tour SuperUnited Rapid in Zagreb. Gukesh's victory propelled him into the sole lead with 10 points, marking a significant moment as he secured his fifth consecutive win. Garry Kasparov noted that Gukesh's convincing win questions Carlsen's domination.

title: Tech jobs lead salary charts: This is how much freshers earn; check new pay hotspots
content: Indeed's PayMap survey reveals that IT and ITeS sectors lead in salary growth, driven by demand for digital and AI skills. While product and project management roles offer the highest pay, UI/UX designers are catching up. Tier-2 cities like Hyderabad and Chennai are emerging as salary hotspots, offering better cost-of-living value despite affordability concerns in major metros.

title: BMC official assault case: BJP leader arrested in Odisha's Jharpada; six held till now
content: Odisha BJP leader Jagannath Pradhan was arrested on Thursday evening for his alleged involvement in the assault on Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation Additional Commissioner Ratnakar Sahu. Pradhan, identified as the main suspect, was apprehended from Jharpada, bringing the total arrests in the case to six. While denying direct involvement, Pradhan pledged cooperation with the ongoing investigation.

title: Bihar elections: Tensions in NDA? Jitan Ram Manjhi warns Chirag Paswan over past 'mistakes'
content: Tensions appear to be simmering within the NDA as Jitan Ram Manjhi warns Chirag Paswan against repeating his 2020 election strategy, hinting at potential consequences. Paswan responded diplomatically, defusing the situation, while the RJD seized the opportunity to highlight perceived rifts within the ruling alliance. The upcoming Bihar elections are anticipated to be a high-stakes battle.

title: From Prince to King! Shubman Gill breaks Kohli and Tendulkar records
content: Shubman Gill now holds the record for the highest score by an Indian Test captain, surpassing Virat Kohli's previous best. Gill's impressive innings adds him to a list of India's top Test performers, including Virender Sehwag, Karun Nair, and VVS Laxman.

title: PM Modi arrives in Trinidad and Tobago on two-day visit
content: During the visit, Prime Minister Modi will hold talks with President Christine Carla Kangaloo and Prime Minister Kamla Persad-Bissessar and discuss further strengthening of the bilateral relationship.

title: Odisha BJP leader arrested over assault on govt. officer; civil servants return to work
content: Additional Commissioner of the Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation was dragged out of his office and assaulted on June 30; videos of the incident went viral, sparking outrage, mass protest by civil servants that severely affected the functioning of State government offices

title: Gujarat HC grants Asaram Bapu his ‘final’ bail extension
content: The Division Bench of Justices Ilesh Vora and PM Raval rejected Asaram’s lawyer’s request for a three-month extension, granting only 30 additional days. This follows the court’s previous interim extension from June 30 to July 7.

title: Ground beneath their feet
content: The 800-year-old, ₹1,400 crore Kolhapuri chappal industry employs close to 1 lakh artisans, and is spread across four districts each of Maharashtra and Karnataka. Vinaya Deshpande Pandit explores the trade and the tradition of this all-leather, nature-derived, hand-stitched footwear, which has been GI tagged. The craft lacks policy impetus, often leading to its misappropriation, the exploitation of its already-marginalised kaarigars, and an erasure of culture

title: Centre on the defensive over Congress’s accusations of ‘subverting’ Forest Act
content: Allegations of subverting forest rights act reflects gross misunderstanding of facts: Environment Ministry

title: Chief Minister inaugurates 208 urban health and wellness centres, 60 PHCs across Tamil Nadu
content: The urban health and wellness centres will function from 8 a.m. and 12 noon and from 4 p.m. to 8 p.m. and offer outpatient care, disease screening, lifestyle counselling, health education, immunisations, and drug delivery, among others

title: Key projects in Ernakulam reviewed at Chief Minister’s regional conference
content: The meeting decided to resolve issues related to the distribution of title deeds in Kothamangalam taluk within a month

title: Kidnapped boy found dead inside forest in Krishnagiri district
content: His body was located following an interrogation of the two persons last seen with him. According the police, the suspects claimed that they had murdered the boy who was from Mavanatti village in Anchetty

title: Married woman cannot claim she was coerced into sex on false promise of marriage, says HC
content: Court grants bail to a person in a case where he allegedly sexually assaulted a married woman on the pretext of marriage and threatened to publish her photos and videos, after borrowing ₹2.5 lakh from her

title: I&B Ministry proposes amendments to rules for TV rating agencies
content: The proposed draft removes some restrictive provisions for media houses to allow more players besides the current Broadcast Audience Research Council (BARC) to democratise the television audience measurement ecosystem

title: Day 4: Protesting FMGs taken away to police stations, detained for nearly 5 hours
content: Government is in favour of the FMGs, and APMC members will be going to New Delhi next week to get clarity from the National Medical Commission regarding internship duration, says APMC Chairman

title: Opposition seeks apology over MLC’s ‘urban Naxal’ remark on wari pilgrimage
content: Holding copies of the Constitution, Opposition parties staged a protest at the Maharashtra Vidhan Bhavan on Thursday, slamming Shiv Sena MLC Manisha Kayande’s remarks alleging “urban Naxal” infiltration in the Pandharpur wari pilgrimage.

title: WB CPI(M) demands judicial inquiry in tendering process of Deocha Pachami coal project
content: CPI(M) State Secretary Md Salim alleges breach of tender, agreement violations in Deocha Pachami coal project

title: Rajeev Kumar Sharma takes charge as Rajasthan DGP in Jaipur
content: The appointment was made on the basis of a recommendation made by the empanelment committee, which was formed by the Union Public Service Commission

title: Maharashtra rolls out round-the-clock sand transport, new measures to regulate mining
content: The move is part of a broader reform that includes GPS tracking, CCTV monitoring, and free sand distribution for housing scheme beneficiaries

title: SRMIST-The Hindu to organise webinar on Future Career Conversations
content: The webinar will delve into the dynamic healthcare landscape and highlight the skill sets required by future doctors and dentists in the era of technological disruptions

title: Preparatory work for Census 2027 begins with conference of Directors of Census Operations
content: Before the first phase begins, a pre-test exercise will be held where tentative questions will be asked by enumerators. The notification for pre-test is likely to be issued in August, a senior government official said.

title: U.P. Cabinet approves ₹4,775 crore expressway linking Agra-Lucknow and Purvanchal corridors
content: According to the government, the proposed expressway will be constructed as a six-lane carriageway, expandable to eight lanes, and will span approximately 49.96 kilometres

title: 'Once I saw A'ja do it, I did it': How Wilson's leg sleeve inspired a new generation
content: The three-time MVP's practical solution to keeping her legs balanced has taken hold across the sports world.

title: Sources: Guardians' Ortiz faces gambling inquiry
content: Guardians right-hander Luis Ortiz is under investigation by MLB after a betting-integrity firm flagged a pair of pitches that had received unusual gambling activity, sources told ESPN.

title: Boxer Chávez Jr. arrested by ICE, to be deported
content: The Department of Homeland Security says Mexican boxer Julio Cesar Chávez Jr. has been arrested by U.S. immigration officers and is being processed for expedited removal from the country.

title: Sources: Lakers to re-sign Hayes on 1-year deal
content: Free agent center Jaxson Hayes has agreed on a one-year deal to return to the Los Angeles Lakers, sources told ESPN.

title: Ex-NBA guard McLemore found guilty of rape
content: An Oregon jury found former NBA guard Ben McLemore guilty Thursday of raping a woman in 2021 while he was playing for the Blazers.

title: Canes sign coveted Ehlers to 6-year, $51M deal
content: The Carolina Hurricanes have made their splashy offseason signing, inking forward Nik Ehlers to a six-year, $51 million contract on Thursday.

title: Liverpool's Jota, brother die in single-car crash
content: Liverpool forward Diogo Jota has died alongside his brother, André Silva, in a car crash near Zamora, Spain in the early hours of Thursday morning, the Civil Guard told the Associated Press.

title: California AG says daily fantasy is illegal in state
content: California Attorney General Rob Bonta released a legal opinion stating that daily fantasy contests are illegal in the state "because they involve betting on sporting events."

title: Steelers sign GM Khan to new 3-year contract
content: The Steelers signed general manager Omar Khan to a new three-year deal, putting him under contract through the 2028 season.

title: 🏈 Fantasy FB sleepers, busts and breakouts
content: Which players will surprise, disappoint or make a big jump this fantasy season? Our analysts give their picks.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Four top-10 teams debut at highest rankings of 2025
content: While the Astros continue their ascent, the Rays and Blue Jays are threatening the Yankees in the AL East.

title: Who’s the best No. 1 NFL draft pick ever? No. 10? No. 262?!? We named top all-time selections at every slot
content: We went through every NFL draft since 1967 and named the best selection at every slot, from Peyton Manning at No. 1 to Brock Purdy at No. 262.

title: NBA free agency winners and losers: Early results are in
content: From big-man depth to the New Orleans Pelicans, here are the early winners and losers of free agency.

title: The four biggest lessons of free agency's first wave
content: Why did so many players simply re-sign instead of exploring the market? Here are 2025's hottest hockey trends.

title: Remembering Diogo Jota, a star whose loss is felt beyond Liverpool
content: The death of Liverpool forward Diogo Jota has caused an outpouring of grief from those associated with the Reds and far beyond. As Jurgen Klopp put it, "there must be a bigger purpose, but I can't see it."

title: How every five-star college football recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 21 five-stars in the Class of '26. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: Is this Djokovic's last chance to win a final Grand Slam?
content: Wimbledon is likely Djokovic's greatest opportunity to win a record 25th Grand Slam. Can he possibly do it?

title: Aces to Dodgers and Cubs? A star closer for Phillies? One trade all 30 teams should make this July
content: The deadline is a month away. Could players such as Eugenio Suarez and Emmanuel Clase finish the season on a different team?

title: Diego Luna, USMNT's Gold Cup hero, is ready to take on Mexico in final
content: Diego Luna has soared up the USMNT depth chart thanks to several big goals during the Gold Cup. Yet the Mexican-American playmaker is taking it all in stride and is excited for his first encounter with El Tri in Sunday's final.

title: Slot, Ronaldo lead tributes to Liverpool star Jota
content: Tributes have been paid to Liverpool forward Diogo Jota after the Portugal international and his brother, André Silva, died in a car crash in Spain.

title: Portugal honor Jota ahead of Euro 2025 opener
content: Portugal and Spain players observed a period of silence before their Women's European Championship opening game Thursday in memory of Portugal and Liverpool forward Diogo Jota.

title: Dortmund announce Jamie Gittens exit for Chelsea
content: Chelsea have agreed a deal to sign English winger Jamie Gittens from Borussia Dortmund, the Bundesliga club said on Thursday.

title: Ex-Arsenal star Ramsey joins Liga MX side Pumas
content: Former Arsenal and Juventus midfielder Aaron Ramsey has signed with Liga MX giants Pumas, the Mexican club announced.

title: Poch: 'Desperate' Luna sets example for USMNT
content: ST. LOUIS -- United States coach Mauricio Pochettino praised goal scorer Diego Luna for being "desperate to play" for the national team after the winger scored twice in a 2-1 Gold Cup semifinal win over Guatemala on Wednesday.

title: Pogba on France return: Still at 'stage one'
content: Paul Pogba has said that he hopes to make a return to the French national team but added that there are "stages" to the process, as he was presented by Monaco on Thursday.

title: Caruso goal gives Italy win over Belgium at Euros
content: Italy won their first match in the Women's European Championship since 2017 as Arianna Caruso struck just before the break to give them a 1-0 win over Belgium in their Group B opener on Thursday.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Portugal honor Jota in Spain rout; Italy win
content: An emotional Portugal side took on Spain, while Italy beat Belgium. Here's what you need to know from Thursday's Euro 2025 action.

title: Meet the 2026 recruits who remind us of some big NBA players
content: Projecting high school talent isn't an exact science, but it's easier when they remind us of NBA stars at that age.

title: Latest rosters for 90-plus teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: Introducing the 'Bag' Hall of Fame: Eight NFL stars who got PAID, over and over and over again
content: Which players have negotiated the most profitable contracts over their careers? Bill Barnwell gives his picks.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye Watkins as Gyökeres alternative
content: Talks have been held between Manchester United and Aston Villa regarding a move for striker Ollie Watkins. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Defiant Verstappen guarded over Mercedes speculation
content: Max Verstappen again refused to be drawn on ongoing speculation he might leave Red Bull for Mercedes in 2026.

title: What to know ahead of the British Grand Prix at Silverstone
content: Seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton is the most successful driver at the British GP with nine wins,

title: Van Gisbergen returns to Chicago, where his NASCAR career began: 'It changed my life'
content: Two years ago, Shane van Gisbergen turned up in Chicago having never raced in NASCAR before. He won. Now he's left his life as an Australian champion behind.

title: Ranking the fights: Usyk-Dubois 2, Taylor-Serrano 3, Pacquiao's return and more
content: From Oleksandr Usyk, a women's trilogy fight and Manny Pacquiao's return, ESPN picks July's best fights.

title: Profar comes back strong? Crawford leads league in steals? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Risers and Fallers: Ionescu struggling, Canada returning to form
content: Sabrina Ionescu's recent shooting struggles and Jordin Canada's production highlight the top risers and fallers in fantasy this week.

title: Put union rooms under lock and key: Calcutta HC directs Bengal govt. after Kolkata law college gang rape case
content: The direction by a Division Bench came while hearing a PIL petition over gang rape incident in a law college in Kolkata last week; the survivor of the sexual assault has claimed that she was confined in the union room of the college

title: INDIA bloc to explore legal options to challenge voter list special revision in Bihar
content: RJD leader Manoj Jha said that the Election Commission’s stance on the migrant population imperils voting rights of people from the Dalit, Backward and minority communities, as they are the ones who usually travel out of the State seeking work

title: Student visa applicants must make their social media public: U.S. Embassy
content: U.S. visa a privilege, not a right, says the Embassy as it lays down the requirement for students seeking visas

title: Mixed reactions to Karnataka’s decision to withdraw permit exemption for electric public transport vehicles
content: In a circular issued on Tuesday, the department revoked the earlier provision that allowed these vehicles to operate without permits, which was in line with the Union Road Transport Ministry’s October 18, 2018, order

title: Global South’s voice key to contemporary world’s progress: PM Modi tells Ghana’s Parliament
content: The Prime Minister calls for global governance reforms to deal with the changing world order, pledging to stand with Ghana as a ‘pillar of strength’

title: Take action against judges who show caste bias in rulings, Congress urges CJI
content: The party cited a recent ruling by the Odisha High Court in which an activist was told to clean a police station for three months as bail conditions

title: Devanahalli protest: Medha Patkar appeals to CM to repeal project ahead of his meeting with farmers on Friday
content: National leaders of Samyukta Kisan Morcha, including Rakesh Tikait, have warned of an intensified agitation if land acquisition is not shelved

title: Shivraj Singh Chouhan joins Muharram mourners in Srinagar, announces housing for five lakh in J&K
content: Union Agriculture Minister co-chairs review meeting with J&K CM; MoU signed to boost women-led food enterprises

title: IPS appointments in CAPFs continue despite Supreme Court order against the move
content: The court had ruled that deputation posts of IPS officers in Senior Administrative Grade or up to the rank of Inspector General in CAPFs should be “progressively reduced over a period of time, say within an outer limit of two years”

title: Failure of State intelligence machinery in custodial death cases comes to the fore
content: In many critical incidents,intelligence sleuths failed to report the brewing tensions or possible misconduct in advance, says note

title: Identity checks along Kanwar route spark row between Samajwadi Party and BJP in Uttar Pradesh
content: Muzaffarnagar incident prompts police action, political blame game erupts over attempts to polarise ahead of Yatra

title: New Garcinia species found in Assam, named after botanist’s mother
content: Garcinia kusumae adds to Assam’s rich floral diversity; discovery published in international taxonomy journal

title: No evidence that COVID-19 vaccination is causing sudden deaths in young people: AIIMS doctors
content: ‘Why such sudden deaths are reported more now could have other causes that are not related to health,’ an AIIMS Delhi specialist said, highlighting the importance of studying the cause of sudden deaths in young people

title: Stability in policies for industries hallmark of Telangana: Revanth Reddy
content: CM opens Malabar Gold and Diamond’s integrated manufacturing facility near Hyderabad, asserts govt. will extend incentives to investors

title: Now travellers will be welcomed with vibrant art towers at Thiruvananthapuram airport
content: The gateway towers at the Chakka overbridge have been transformed into dazzling art towers, each narrating a unique cultural story

title: Bihar draft electoral rolls to be published on August 1; final list to be out on September 30
content: Final electoral rolls will be prepared only after disposing of claims and objections and no deletion will be made without due inquiry and providing the person concerned a fair hearing, the Election Commission said.

title: Suspension of Kerala University Registrar draws flak
content: Criticising Vice-Chancellor’s move to suspend Registrar, Higher Education Minister R. Bindu says he has misused his power and the State will seek legal advice. Leader of the Opposition says V-C’s move is legally unsustainable

title: Residents oppose move to expand SIPCOT complex near Cheyyar
content: The phase-3 project, initiated a decade ago, involves the acquisition of 3,174 acres of land from nine farming villages in Anakavoor near Cheyyar. Residents have been protesting against the project for over three years

title: India, Australia launch joint research project on undersea surveillance
content: Project will explore using Towed Array Target Motion Analysis to improve the reliability, efficiency and interoperability of current surveillance capabilities

title: Govt. notifies rules for latest Amaravati Land Pooling Scheme
content: With fewer forms and use of technology, administrative burden will come down and accuracy will improve in the new process, says S. Suresh Kumar, Principal Secretary of MAUD

title: Bescom to simplify online electricity meter name transfer for a hassle-free experience
content: A senior official of Bescom says the system is under development, and is being developed in association with BBMP on its portal

title: Indigenous defence procurement worth ₹1.05 lakh crore cleared
content: In its first meeting after Operation Sindoor, DAC gave the nod to buy equipment for effective air defence and to enhance operational preparedness of the armed forces; it approved acquisition of QRSAMs worth ₹30,000 crore for the Army

title: New West Bengal BJP chief seeks Left supporters’ help to oust Trinamool from power
content: Samik Bhattacharya urges Opposition parties to set aside ideologies and unite to defeat Trinamool in 2026 State poll; however, State LoP warns people to be cautious of Left parties, which have caused BJP losses

title: We are game for competition: HAL chief
content: In May, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh approved the execution model for AMCA and opened the doors for the private sector to compete with the Bengaluru-headquartered defence PSU

title: Watch: Sivaganga custodial death: The chilling murder of Ajith Kumar | Focus Tamil Nadu
content: A young temple security guard was picked up by a special police team without an FIR. Beaten until he lied. Tortured until he collapsed. Declared dead before he could tell the world his side of the story. What happened to Ajith Kumar?

title: Social media accounts of Pakistani stars blocked again
content: Brief visibility sparks online uproar; government cites cross-border tensions and digital media regulations for clampdown

title: Committee suggests easing of purchase procedures at MCH
content: Report by the four-member committee, submitted report to the DME, says many aspects relating to the purchase processes in MCHs can be improved. Report likely to be submitted to Minister today

title: Draft regulations on renewable energy: traders, prosumers protest in front of State Electricity Regulatory Commission office
content: They call the draft regulations impractical and damaging. Traders observe a ‘Solar Bandh’ by keeping  firms involved in the manufacture, sale, installation and service of the renewable energy components shut as part of the protest

title: RRR will be six-lane: Komatireddy
content: ‘The Telangana government has called tenders worth ₹6,500 crore for the construction of village roads after coming to power’

title: Wealth case registered against cop
content: The officer amassed assets worth ₹92.17 lakh, of which assets worth ₹29.26 lakh were beyond his known sources of income, says VACB

title: Terror suspects arrested in Rayachoti have links with banned outfit ‘Al Ummah’, say police
content: The two accused have been arrested based on warrants issued by the Tamil Nadu Police in connection with multiple bomb blasts since 1990s, say Kurnool Range DIG and Annamayya district SP; the police have also seized a large quantum of explosive material, terrorist literature, and other incriminating documents

title: Smouldering Wan Hai 503 still adrift without a port of refuge
content: An assessment by the salvage team stresses the need for a port of refuge, as removing fuel from the vessel offshore remains unsafe. Weather in the Arabian Sea is the major hindrance to the containment of fire and smoke, says crew member

title: PM Modi Arrives In Trinidad & Tobago, Gets Guard Of Honour
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived here on Thursday on the second leg of his five-nation tour, during which he will hold talks with the top leadership of Trinidad and Tobago to further strengthen the bilateral relationship.

title: Trump Says "Didn't Make Any Progress" On Ukraine During Putin Call
content: US President Donald Trump said he had made no progress with Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin towards a ceasefire in Ukraine after the two leaders spoke by phone on Thursday.

title: Russia Becomes 1st Country To Recognise Taliban Government Of Afghanistan
content: Russia said on Thursday it had accepted the credentials of a new ambassador of Afghanistan, making it the first nation to recognise the Taliban government of the country.

title: How Will Trump's 'Big Beautiful Bill' Impact US Climate Policy?
content: With the passage of his party's "One Big Beautiful Bill," Republican President Donald Trump has largely delivered on his promise of curtailing Joe Biden's landmark climate law.

title: 'Caution Not Anti-Science': Siddaramaiah On Covid Vaccine-Sudden Death Claim
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has responded to Biocon Ltd Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw's suggestion that he acknowledge the science behind vaccine development, rather than engage in retrospective blame.

title: Trump To Sign Flagship Bill On US Independence Day Today: White House
content: US President Donald Trump will sign his "big beautiful" tax and spending bill in a ceremony on Independence Day on Friday after it passed Congress, the White House said.

title: Trump Scores Big Victory As 'One Big Beautiful Bill' Clears Congress
content: US President Donald Trump secured a major political victory when Congress narrowly passed his flagship tax and spending bill, cementing his radical second-term agenda and boosting funds for his anti-immigration drive.

title: Puducherry Man Made To Pay Rs 38,000 Interest Per Month For Rs 3.8 Lakh Loan, Dies By Suicide
content: In a case of alleged usury and harassment, a 33-year-old small entrepreneur, Vikram, died by suicide in Puducherry, after he was unable to cope with relentless pressure from private moneylenders charging exorbitant interest.

title: More Communities In Manipur Join Call For Ending Deal With Kuki Militants, Write To Amit Shah
content: Four influential civil society organisations from different communities in Manipur have for the first time made a united call against extending what they called a "flawed and violated" tripartite agreement.

title: Karnataka BJP Leader N Ravikumar Faces FIR Over Derogatory Remarks Against Chief Secretary
content: Karnataka Police have filed an FIR against the Chief Whip and BJP MLC N. Ravikumar on Thursday for allegedly issuing derogatory remarks on the Chief Secretary Shalini Rajneesh.

title: Bengaluru Ferrari Owner Evades Road Tax, Made To Pay Rs 1.42 Crore
content: In a high-octane crackdown on tax evasion, a Ferrari owner was forced to shell out Rs 1.42 crore after Regional Transport Office officials caught the luxury supercar being used on the streets of Bengaluru without road tax being paid in Karnataka.

title: Probe Agency Arrests West Bengal Man Who Extorted Money By Posing As Its Officer
content: The Enforcement Directorate on Thursday said it has arrested a man from West Bengal who allegedly impersonated as its officer and extorted money from businessmen by threatening them with money laundering investigation.

title: "Agriculture Issues Most Sensitive": US Ex Envoy To India On Interim Trade Deal
content: Atul Keshap, president of the United States India Business Council (USIBC), has pointed out that agriculture issues are always the most sensitive issues in any trade negotiation.

title: Jewellery, Cash Stolen From Delhi Government Officer's Home During Trip: Cops
content: Expensive jewellery, lakhs in cash and foreign currency were stolen from the central Delhi residence of a government officer while he was travelling abroad with his family, police said on Thursday.

title: Covid Vaccines Not Behind Sudden Deaths, Suggests Top Medical Body Study
content: None of the Covid vaccine doses are linked to heart attacks and deaths, said Dr Sudheer Arava from AIIMS, who is part of the research currently underway by the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) and the All India Institute of Medical Sciences.

title: Will The EU Delay Enforcing Its AI Act?
content: With less than a month to go before parts of the European Union's AI Act come into force, companies are calling for a pause in the provisions and getting support from some politicians. European companies have urged the AI act to be delayed by years.

title: 'Reservoir Dogs' And 'Kill Bill' Star Michael Madsen Dies At 66
content: Michael Madsen, whose menacing characters in "Reservoir Dogs" and "Kill Bill" made him a standout in Quentin Tarantino's films, has died.

title: Bomb Threats Disrupt Flights at Six Major Canadian Airports
content: Major Canadian airports were forced to delay some flights Thursday after receiving bomb threats, according to the country's air traffic authority.

title: "Finding Documents...": RJD's Manoj Jha On Row Over Bihar Poll Roll Revision
content: Bihar is preparing for the Assembly Elections this year, and the Election Commission has launched the Special Intensive Revision of the state's voter list, a move that has sparked a massive political row.

title: "Fuel Ban On End-Of-Life Vehicles Not Feasible" Delhi Minister To Pollution Body
content: Delhi's Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa has written to the CAQM seeking a rollback of the End-of-Life vehicle impounding order, citing technological and logistical hurdles.

title: Trump's 'Big, Beautiful Bill' passed by House, US President likely to sign it on July 4 ceremony
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. title: 'Had just 30 seconds’: Pak PM's aide recalls near-nuclear panic after India’s BrahMos strike
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Luna eclipse: No stars, no problem as USMNT finds new focal point
content: the united states defeated Guatemala 2-1 to advance to the final of the Concacaf gold cup . the men's national team beat the country 2-1 in the semifinal . a brace from Diego Luna put the U.S. up 1-0 early on .

title: Top 50 trade deadline candidates -- and their best landing spots
content: Xavier Scruggs names the players he believes could be up for grabs at the trade deadline . some of the players on the list are unlikely to be dealt but at least are being discussed in potential deals . players are ranked by value for their new team, not likelihood of being dealt .

title: PLL Power Rankings at the All-Star break: Who's the new No. 1?
content: the worst team in the league can beat the best team . half the league's teams are now 3-2 and the other half are 2-3 . the team vs. team play is off for the weekend as the PLL descends on Kansas City .

title: New look New York: How Mike Brown changes the Knicks' approach
content: Shams Charania joins "the Pat McAfee Show" a month after the new york Knicks elected to move on from coach Tom Thibodeau . the franchise is expected to hire two-time coach of the year Mike Brown .

title: Which clubs are the best transfer fit for Europe's top strikers?
content: arsenal have had the 22-year-old on their radar for some time . but the drawn-out nature of negotiations over a potential €70 million move raises some questions . he offers both a target to play the ball in to and a threat in behind the defense .

title: Kershaw joins the 3K club! Where does he rank among pitchers with 3,000 strikeouts?
content: the 3,000-strikeout club has grown by one, with Clayton Kershaw becoming the 20th pitcher in baseball history to reach that milestone . the 3K pitching club doesn't generate as much hullabaloo as its hitting counterpart, but it is more exclusive: Thirty-three players have reached 3,000 hits .

title: Madden NFL 26 features a fully reworked Superstar mode
content: superstar mode is celebrating its 20th anniversary in Madden NFL 26 . the integration with College Football's Road to Glory mode returns as well . players will get realistic opportunities on the field to replace an injured player or wrap up a dominant victory from time to time .
